Posts.Content: Hang in there mjimsr! I'll be thinking positive thoughts for you and your surgical team. Take it easy and let your body heal. Post any issues you have - many people here have dealt with them and can offer advice. I know i learned some tricks that made things easier during recovery. Best of luck to you and I look forward to hearing how it went in a few days. Dan
Posts.Signature: Age 54 History of Bladder Cancer X 3 dating back to 1983 SUMMARY PROSTATE CANCER DATA: Specimen type: Radical Prostatectomy Specimen weight includes: Prostate without seminal vesicles Histologic type: Adenocarcinoma, NOS (81403) Histologic (Gleason) Grade: Primary: 4 + Secondary: 3 = Total: 7 Seminal vesicle invasion: Left S.V. present; negative for invasion Right S.V. present; negative for invasion Angiolymphatic invasion: Not identified Extensive perineural invasion: Present Lymph Node Status Node summary: Nodes with carcinoma: 0 / Total nodes examined: 19 Minimum Pathologic Stage (AJCC, 7th ed., 2010) Primary tumor (pT): pT3a: Extraprostatic extension and/or microscopic invasion of bladder neck Regional lymph nodes (pN): pN0
Posts.Title: The Countdown Begins

Posts.Content: Hi Seacock, Sounds to me like your moving fast. I'm at 4 months post Da Vinci and an erection is a complete impossibility, even with a handful of cialis. Orgasm is achievable though and i've found that if i empty my bladder immediately before, i do not leak. Also, if i'm on my back, i'm far less likely to leak. So - let her do the work for a while and you might be surprised. Best of luck and keep it pointed up. Cheers
Posts.Signature: Age 54 History of Bladder Cancer X 3 dating back to 1983 SUMMARY PROSTATE CANCER DATA: Specimen type: Radical Prostatectomy Specimen weight includes: Prostate without seminal vesicles Histologic type: Adenocarcinoma, NOS (81403) Histologic (Gleason) Grade: Primary: 4 + Secondary: 3 = Total: 7 Seminal vesicle invasion: Left S.V. present; negative for invasion Right S.V. present; negative for invasion Angiolymphatic invasion: Not identified Extensive perineural invasion: Present Lymph Node Status Node summary: Nodes with carcinoma: 0 / Total nodes examined: 19 Minimum Pathologic Stage (AJCC, 7th ed., 2010) Primary tumor (pT): pT3a: Extraprostatic extension and/or microscopic invasion of bladder neck Regional lymph nodes (pN): pN0
Posts.Title: New Memeber- Had My Da Vinci Surgery 12/11/20105

Posts.Content: Hi - This has been one wild ride. Gleason Score of 4+3=7 led to a Radical Prostatectomy sparing 1 nerve. Post op internal urine leaking visible through cystogram and felt like unbelievable labor cramps 3-4 times per day. Catheter remained in place for 31 long days. I felt hopeless on several occasions but my wife dragged me on. Constipation (should be written in capital letters) beyond description. Had my first post op PSA at >0.05. This came with no explanation and was perceived by me as not being zero and therefore, more bad news. Fortunately my Urologist was available and explained that this is goodness... At 66 days, I leak when i stand, cough, sneeze, clear my throat, and laugh. Doing my exercises but no progress. Thinking of buying Tena stock... Despite sparing 1 nerve, there is no erection. Insurance refuses 5mg daily Cialis but approves 2.5mg despite price being the same. No effect whatsoever... Whoda thunk at 54, no sex and wearing panty liners. Hopeful but not too confident. I could live with the incontinence if only the ED could be solved. Having a wife 18 years younger than me used to be a thrilling thing. Good luck to you all, Dan
